use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeFour British lads who became meme sensations have announced they are selling their original viral image in an NFT auction with a reserve price set at £million. Jamie Philips, Connor Humpage, Kevin Rooney and Alex Lacey are known as ‘The Four Lads in Jeans’ after an image of the four wearing tight trousers on a night out went viral. The four have told of bullying and trolling they suffered after their image began whipping around the world. But the pandemic apossea shantyapos TikTok fad gave their online fame a fresh bump, as a video of the pals appearing to sing the Wellerman delighted the internet. Now, the lads have revealed they are selling their famous meme as digital artwork for £ million in a bid to raise awareness of online trolling, Birmingham Live reports. The auction is in partnership with cyber bullying charity CyberSmile and aims to raise awareness of trolling online. Their auction comes after a string of high-profile meme subjects raked in rewards after years of unexpected fame - and oftentimes humiliation. The girl in the famous smirking disaster meme taken when she was five years old sold the image for almost £, -years-later. Zoe Roth, now , was photographed by her father grinning devilishly in front of a controlled house fire in Mebane, North Carolina. The image became the perfect meme as the meme took on a le of its own as internet users transplanted the smirking childaposs face in pictures of disasters and news pictures.  Now, , Zoe scrored USD, - almost £, - after selling the rights to the image to a collector simply known as @FMusic. Selling images as non-fungible tokensin the way Zoe has done - and the Four Lads are hoping to do too - give the pictures unique digital signature which allow them to be sold like a piece of art  The four ladsapos announcement comes following a weekend blackout across football aimed at eliminating online abuse and ahead of World Mental Health Week.  Their auction is taking place from Thursday th May to Thursday th May on leading NFT marketplace Rarible. “Our image has created some of the best but also worst moments in our lives having experienced some of the highs and lows which come with the public spotlight.Our ultimate goal is to support in eradicating online abuse, and we hope the sale of our image can contribute towards this, The Four Lads in Jeans explained. Since going viral, the ladsapos meme has been shared by the likes of Conor McGregor, Harry Redknapp, Manchester City FC, Liam Gallagher, Piers Morgan.

title: french trawler deliberately rams jersey
story: NewsFrench trawler deliberately rams Jersey mans boat as fishing row escalatesTwo Royal navy ships were positioned nearby Jersey businessman Jonathan Ruff faced a flotilla of French boats to "stick up" for the island and do his "patriotic duty"mirrorShareCommentsByChris KitchingSenior News Reporter:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY News" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice A Jersey resident claims his boat was deliberately rammed by a French trawler as tensions escalated in a fresh row over fishing rights.Dramatic video shows the collision as a flotilla of about  French boats crowded the harbour at St Helier a day after two Royal Navy ships were sent to the Channel island. In a defiant protest, a member of the Jersey Militia re-enactment group, wearing a replica of the three-cornered hat worn once by soldiers, fired a musket towards the sea as the harbour stand-off dragged on.Angry French fishermen blocked a freight ferry from leaving, lot flares and waved banners, claiming their rights to fish the waters have been unfairly restricted after Brexit. Were you affected by the demonstration  Let us know at webnews@mirror.Jersey property developer Jonathan Ruff claims a French trawler deliberately rammed his boat as he went out to face the flotilla to stick up for the island and do his patriotic duty. Footage online showed two boats colliding in the harbour and witnesses shout oh following the sound of the impact.Mr Ruff told the Sun: I couldnapost believe what he was doing. He deliberately sped up and went straight for me clipping my bow.aposaposIf he had hit my engine I would have been in big, big trouble, I could have lost the boat and anything could have happened.  aposaposThey were out of order andit wasnapost for some quick evasive action my boat could have been at the bottom of the Channel. Mr Ruff, who runs restaurants and wants to open a casino and strip club on the island, accused the French captain of being totally reckless. The Brussels-backed French boats arrived at about am - like an invasion, according to one local fisherman - and remained in the harbour until they began tohome at about pm. Their departure followed positive talks between Jersey ministers and the organisers of the protest. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  At one point during the demonstration, a member of the Jersey Militia re-enactment group shot a blank-firing musket towards the water from Elizabeth Castle. The sight of dozens of French fishing vessels approaching the British Crown dependency as flares shot up into the sky looked “like an invasion”, said Jersey fisherman Josh Dearing. The -year-old, who owns The Jersey Catch fishing company and is originally from Kent, said the scene was “was quite a sight”. He added: “There were probably about  boats. There were a few hand-held flares and smoke flares going off and apparently a few maybe bangers and stuff going off from the French. It was impressive, I looked from the shore this morning and it was just like a sea of red lights and flares already going off at sea. It was like an invasion.” There had been rumblings about a planned protest a few days ago, Mr Dearing said, but added that he had not been sureit was “serious or empty threats”. He said: “The French being the French, they don’t mess around. They can blockade their own harbours – they wouldn’t think twice about coming and doing it to us.” Mr Dearing was “absolutely” pleased to hear on Wednesday night that Royal Navy vessels were being deployed to patrol the waters around Jersey. He said: “We’re completely unprotected in Jersey. We’ve got nothing except for a few police officers. We don’t have a police boat, we don’t have a navy boat, we don’t have anything to protect us. “The French can be hostile. All of our livelihoods are in that harbour andthey wanted to they could cause damage.” The Royal Navy patrol boats HMS Severn and HMS Tamar were positioned some distance away. France sent two police boats - Athos and Themis - to patrol the area, but they did not approach the flotilla or the Royal Navy ships.  A spokeswoman for the French maritime authority for the Channel and the North Sea said they were being stationed to be in a position to intervene “as quickly as possible”the situation worsens. Jersey’s external relations minister, Ian Gorst, said talks between island ministers and the organisers of the protest were “positive”.He told BBC Radio aposs World at One programme: “It really is important that what has escalated over the course of the last three days, that we move away from that escalation and disproportionate threats, and start to deal with those detailed technical issues.The row began after Jersey implemented new requirements under the terms of the UK-EU trade deal for boats to submit evidence of their past fishing activities in order to receive a licence to carry on operating in Jersey waters.

title: how cope loss you live
story: AdvertorialHow to cope with loss when you live alone -  ideas to help you feel betterLosing a loved one is hard enough, but especially soyoure by yourselfmirrorShareByLaura Tait:,  APR AdvertorialNobody knows just how they will react after losing someone close to them. We will all be affected by grief at some point – something that has proved all too true for many people as a result of the pandemic. There is of course no “right” or “normal” way to grieve – everyone will experience their own emotional journey following a bereavement. We shouldn’t be putting pressure on ourselves to experience a certain sensation – like anger or acceptance – at a certain time, says Andy Langford, clinical director at Cruse Bereavement Care. Instead, we should be giving ourselves time and space.But it can be particularly hard when you live alone. The following advice from Co-op Funeralcare might help:Keep talking One thing that can give comfort is talking about your feelings with friends or family, so it’s important not to become isolated. Stay connected Use video and phone calls and social media to stay in touch. Arrange times to chat with people – having this in your diary can add something to look forward to and purpose to your day.  Stick to a routine As much as possible, try to get up at the same time each day, and prepare and eat meals when you normally would. If you can, get outside to exercise. Don’t be too ambitious Set yourself manageable tasks. Sometimes that will simply be getting out for a walk. Getting the balance right between being busy as a distraction and taking the time to focus on your grief is key. Look after your health Maintaining healthy habits for your physical wellbeing can help with your emotional welfare. As you focus on looking after yourself and practise self-care, remember that your GP will be able to offer advice on coping with bereavement

title: kate middleton gives glimpse inside
story: NewsKate Middleton gives glimpse inside her new book day after Meghan Markle reveals hersIt comes amid accusations that her sister-in-law Meghan Markle was "trying to upstage" her after announcing her own book, titled The BenchmirrorShareCommentsByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  MAY NewsThe project captured British le during the pandemic " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeKate Middleton has shared a glimpse into her photobook aposHold Stillapos ahead of its launch on Friday - a day after he sister-in-law unveiled her own childrenaposs book. The project, a collection of  photographs which captured le in the UK under lockdown and the Covid- pandemic, has been ongoing for a year. It will be released on May  and the Duchess of Cambridge has put out a video showing a brief glimpse into its contents via social media.The tease of the work came amid accusations that her sister-in-law Meghan Markle was trying to upstage her after announcing her own book, titled aposThe Bench.apos That book is said to be about the special relationship between a dad and a son. It is inspired by her husband Prince Harry and their son Archie, and will be published next month. On the Cambridgeaposs official Instagram account a video has been posted showing a number of pages from the book and some of the portraits that have been selected.The social media post is captioned with the words Coming this Friday...#HoldStill. The brief tease sparked a number of enthusiastic responses from fans who praised the Duchessaposs work.  One wrote: This was such a fantastic project. Congratulations to the Duchess of Cambridge for this awesome initiative. Another said: So excited to keep this for my son as he grows. Something for him to get a glimpse of the lives of normal people living through Covid. Thank you everyone who were involved. The Hold Still project was launched last year and invited people of all ages from across the UK to submit a photographic portrait which they had taken during the first lockdown.  From over , images submitted,  final portraits were selected and shown in a digital exhibition before being displayed across the UK. The book, named Hold Still: A Portrait of Our Nation in , will raise vital cash for mental health charity Mind and the National Portrait Gallery. Mum-of-three Kate wanted to create a lasting legacy of how the country has collectively and inidually battled through lockdown, celebrating the NHS and recognising how everyday people have coped during the pandemic.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeThe Duke and Duchess of Cambridge took to social media to wish their nephew, Archie, a happy second birthday. Meghan Markle and Prince Harryaposs little boy is celebrating his special day in America, where the Sussexes have been living since quitting the royal family last year. To mark the day, Kate and William shared a photo taken at Archieaposs christening on Insagram and Twitter.The snap, taken by Chris Allerton, shows the Cambridges, Sussexes, Prince Charles, Camilla, Meghanaposs mum Doria and Princess Dianaaposs sisters. Prince Charles and Camilla also shared a snap to mark the day, but opted for a photo without Meghan. They reshared a picture that Harry and Meghan shared on Fatheraposs Day, showing Harry with his father and son at his christening. They wrote: Happy birthday to Archie, who turns two today. The Queen posted one of the photos taken at the photocall where Meghan and Harry introduced the world to Archie, in place of the traditional hospital steps photo. She wrote: Wishing Archie Mountbatten-Windsor a very happy nd birthday today. The birthday message comes after a dficult few months for brothers William and Harry and countless reports of tension between the couples. William was reportedly furious when his younger brother quit The Firm, with insiders saying he was only given about  minutes notice.  Things were made even worse by Meghan and Harryaposs interview with Oprah Winfrey, in which they made several shocking claims about the royal family. Harry said his brother was trapped in the institution while Meghan accused Kate of making her cry. Meghan also claimed she wasnapost able to get help for her mental health during her time in the royal family, despite having suicidal thoughts. She told Oprah she didnapost want to be alive anymore.

news uk-news meghan-harry-could-hire-army-"" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeAn army of nannies, sleep consultants, therapists, yoga teachers and personal chefs - these are the luxuries enjoyed by Los Angelesapos rich and famous when they welcome a new baby. Thanks to their wealth and notoriety, Meghan Markle and Prince Harry will have a range of experts available to themneeded when their baby girl arrives and they juggle raising two young children and holding down careers. Given their multi-million pound deals with Netflix and Spoty, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex can afford to have a day nanny and a night nanny, and extra help from the likes of a maternal wellbeing therapist or a nutritionist, say parenting experts. Heavily-pregnant Meghan, , is due to give birth this summer, reportedly as soon as early June, and royal watchers expect she will lean on her mum Doria Ragland, , for help. The girl will join birthday boy Archie, who turns two today, and be the Sussexesapos second child since their wedding in . The American duchess gave birth to son Archie at the exclusive and private Portland hospital in London in May , and rumours have suggested she could opt for a home birth in the coupleaposs mansion in suburban Los Angeles this time. Ms Ragland, who spent time with the couple at Frogmore Cottage in Windsor after Archieaposs birth, lives close to the couple and is expected to provide similar support when her granddaughter is born. Harryaposs family is , miles away and he relies on video calls to keep in touch with the Queen and other family members who are still speaking to him amid a rt that was widened by the Sussexesapos bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey. Meghan is estranged from her father Thomas Markle Snr, who is orced from her mother, and her paternal half-siblings Thomas Markle Jnr and Samantha Markle. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, William, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte, Louis, Archie and the rest of the family. Weaposll send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here. With limited family support, the Sussexes will have their hands full as they raise two children while running their documentary and podcast empire, and doing charity work. When Archie was born, reports claimed Meghan and Harry had just one nanny for him, but had tried out three in his first three months. Parenting experts said the Sussexes could turn to multiple nannies and other experts for help with their two children, especiallyMeghan doesnapost take a y period of maternity leave. Sophie Pickles, an early years teacher and parenting coach, told the Mirror: “Meghan and Harry may choose to hire a team of two or more nannies to help care for Archie and the new baby. “It is not uncommon for royals or the extremely wealthy to do so, often employing one nanny to stay in the house overnight to help with frequent night wakes and one or more to take care of the children during the day. “We know that when Archie was born, Meghan and Harry decided to hire a nanny to help them after initially saying they wouldnapost do so. “As for all of us, it sometimes takes until the baby is born for new parents to realise what a challenge it can be.” She added: “We already know that Harry and Meghan have stated that they do not want their home to be filled with staff, so it is unlikely that the new nanny will live with them. “All parents of multiple children know, however, that two is more challenging than one and with Archie about to hit the tumultuous age of two, they may well change their minds.”  It’s not known how much time self-employed Meghan and Harry will take from work off following the birth of their baby girl. As for how they could do things dferently this time, the couple could lean more on Ms Ragland and close friends. Ms Pickles said: “With Meghanaposs mum living close by, it is likely that she will be called upon to offer support and help, not only for Meghan as she recovers from birth but in caring for Archie while the family adjusts to having a new member. “After all, even when you have all the money in the world, there is nothing quite like the reassurance of leaving your baby in the arms of someone that you love and trust.” Royal biographer Angela Levin said itaposs possible the Sussexes will have more help around them after this birth, given they will have two children to take care of while running a business and doing charity work. The author of Harry: Conversations with the Prince told the Mirror: Meghan’s mother will want to help them and be involved, and the second one will be very close to her. I thinkwill rethink those early weeks . First-time mothers think they can do everything themselves. She might well have a night nanny and day nanny to help her, particularlyshe is working. You can’t juggle two in the same way that you can juggle one. I imagine a lot of money will come rolling in before she gives birth. They will be able to afford it.  Meghan and Harry, , are fortunate to have the kind of wealth and celebrity status that provide a gateway to experts and services most parents could never afford. The rich and famous in Los Angeles aren’t afraid to hire help or spend ridiculous amounts of money to get aposthe bestapos for their newborn.After her daughter Stormi Webster was born in February , reports claimed Kylie Jenner had four nannies.Kim Kardashian is said to have an “army” of nannies to help her care for the four children she had with Kanye West.Ms Pickles said: “While some of us can seek the services of sleep or lactation consultants for a one-off session, Meghan and Harry would be able to hire personal advisors to answer questions day and night. “They could take the form of an occupational therapist, paediatric doctors and physiotherapists, day and night nannies, a parent coach, a sleep consultant, a lactation consultant or a family counsellor - not to mention a personal trainer specialising in postpartum exercise, a nutritionist, a chef and a housekeeper.”  Lucy Shrimpton, founder of the Sleep Nanny, said Meghan and Harry could try to take on as much as they can on their own. She said: “Meghan and Harry are in a very privileged position that they have the means to pay for as much help as they could possibly need. “However, Meghan and Harry may want to do it as much as possible on their own. They seem like a very tight family, not afraid to get their hands dirty when it comes to all parenting responsibilities so they may try to be as self sufficient as possible.” Help from a sleep expert could set them up for long-term benefits such as the child’s development, and the familyaposs health and mental wellbeing. Ms Shrimpton added: “Being prepared with lots of rest before the baby arrives will be hugely beneficial for Meghan and Harry because the demands on parents of two will more than double. “Speaking from experience, where I went into labour already shattered with a -month-old, having plenty of time to rest beforehand will make a huge dference.  “Itaposs not as easy to catch up on sleep after having a baby when you have a toddler too. They may need to consider Archieaposs sleep and any adjustments to make to ensure he is not unsettled by the new sibling arriving into his world and demanding the attention of his parents.” Awena Naomie Ella, a matrescence specialist, motherhood wellbeing coach and occupational therapist, said Meghan could benefit from a specialist such as a maternal wellbeing therapist, who can help to set boundaries that allow for “rest, calm and connection”. She said: “Itaposs important to be aware of the hormonal, psychological, physiological, emotional, and spiritual changes a woman will move through. “Meghan’s wellbeing is the key to a safe and enjoyable entrance into this next phase of her and Harry’s le. “It is also important not to neglect or fail to acknowledge the emotional and wellbeing needs of Harry too. Ms Ella added: “Having access to a maternal wellbeing therapist or motherhood specialist, for example, can aid and support Meghan to embrace some simple and gentile wellbeing activates that fit into her current lestyle, and help her to prevent and manage any anxiety, possible onset of depression, overwhelm, and loss of sense of self that can sometimes come with early motherhood.

title: meghan markle sends coded message
story: NewsMeghan Markle sends coded message to royals in her new childrens book, says expertMeghan Markles book, The Bench, started off as a poem the Duchess of Sussex wrote for Prince Harry but shes now developed the idea into a moving storymirrorShareCommentsByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  MAY NewsIngrid believes that Meghan is sending a message to the royals " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice Meghan Markle is sending a coded message to the royal family about their decision to strip Prince Harry of his military titles in her new childrenaposs book, a royal author has claimed.The Duchess of Sussex announced earlier this week that she has written the new book, titled The Bench, which tells the story of fathers and their sons through a motheraposs eyes. Many fans have praised the book and thousands have already pre-ordered a copy. However Majesty magazineaposs Ingrid Seward believes that one of the pages shows the coupleaposs feelings towards Harry losing his royal military positions following Megxit. The beautul illustration shows a ginger hair dad dressed in Army unorm being reunited with his son, who he throws in the air, while the mum watches on through the window.  Writing for the Sun, Ingrid points out that this is something Archie has never seen, adding: Maybe Meghan is sending us a coded message that Harry has still not got over losing his military titles after the Queen stepped in.She also accuses Meghan of being hypocritical for writing a book about fatherhoods when she is still not speaking to her own. Her relationship with Thomas Markle has been dficult since the royal wedding but things were made worse when he gave a copy of her emotional handwritten letter to the Mail on Sunday.  Ingrid writes: Nor am I surprised at Meghan’s hypocrisy in writing a book about the joy of father and son bonding when the relationship between Harry and his own father Prince Charles has been brought to an all-time low by their Oprah interview. Meghan’s estranged dad, Thomas, lives roughly  miles away but she has not taken Harry or Archie to see him. I suspect Mr Markle believes they never will make that journey or repair the relationship.Royal author Phil Dampier agrees with Ingrid, telling The Sun : Meghan is probably showing how much the Army meant to Harry and how upset he is to lose his military titles.For Harry, who put his le on the line and then founded the highly successful Invictus Games for injured servicemen and women, losing the titles was the bitterest part of ‘Megxit.’  The Bench is being released through publisher Random House, and the cover features her royal title, The Duchess of Sussex. In a statement, Meghan said: The Bench started as a poem I wrote for my husband on Fatheraposs Day, the month after Archie was born,aposapos Meghan said in a statement. That poem became this story. My hope is that The Bench resonates with every family, no matter the makeup, as much as it does with mine.” It is narrated by award winning artist Christian Robinson Meghan, who is described as a mother, we, feminist and activist in the bio, will narrate the audiobook.

title: mum sets record fastest labour
story: NewsMum sets record for fastest labour by giving birth in loo in just  secondsAstonished Sophie Bugg, , from Basingstoke, Hampshire, said she had just thought she needed to do a number two - and less than a minute later she was leaving the bathroom with a new babymirrorShareCommentsByCharlotte Penketh-King:,  MAY NewsSophie Buggs daughter Millie was clearly eager to arrive into the world " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA mum gave birth in what may be one of the quickest times ever with just one push - and  seconds. Sophie Bugg, , was  weeks pregnant when she popped to the loo in the middle of the night - only to leave the bathroom with a baby less than a minute later. Her partner Chris, , had to act fast as Sophie appeared outside the bathroom door with the babyaposs head between her legs. With just one big push, baby Millie was born into her astonished dadaposs arms. Despite her extremely quick arrival, she is doing well with her family at their home in Basingstoke, Hampshire. Full time mum-of-three Sophie said: She was ridiculously fast! One moment Iaposm texting my friend on the toilet about needing a poo and seconds later, Iaposve got a baby in my arms. Actually pushing her out from when the lady on the phone told me to push only lasted  seconds, it was so fast. I had no pains and my waters hadnapost broken, there was no realisation I was having her at all. It sounds really crude but it just felt like I needed to go for a poo.Have you got a birth story  Email webnews@mirrorI had messaged my friend saying I donapost feel great, then put the phone down from where I was sat on the loo and went to get up from the toilet. As I went to lt myself up, my body just got that feeling like I needed to push for a poo. So I sat back down, pushed, and as soon as I did that push, I knew it was not from behind! I put my hand between my legs and her head was completely out. I shouted to my partner for help, went from the toilet to outside my toilet door on the top of the stairs, did one push and she was out! This isnapost the first time that Sophie has been taken by surprise by her speedy deliveries.  Back in , the mum went to the toilet in the middle of the night and ended up delivering her first baby, Paige, now eight, just  minutes later. Little Paige was born still in her sac, which is why Sophieaposs waters didnapost break, and a paramedic was able to pop the sac safely. Sophie was then booked in for an induction for her second child Lexie, now two, to ensure she was in hospital this time around. She gave birth to Lexie just  minutes after being induced.  She said: My first baby was quite an experience - you donapost expect anything like that with your first labour, to just be at home and then all of a sudden youaposve got a baby. You donapost know what to expect. You get told all these dferent things from people like youaposre going to have a show, youaposll have waters go, so youaposre waiting for these things to happen and they didnapost for me so I didnapost think I was giving birth until her head was out. My second baby, the doctors were so worried with the fact of how quickly I had my first that they had me induced so I was in hospital with my second, which was a relief. But then my third baby had the exact same plans as my first, but came even quicker! I couldnapost believe how quickly she arrived.  My body doesnapost give me the signs of labour. My midwe and my consultant told me that I go from zero to baby, I donapost dilate like every normal person does. Sophie had been booked in to be induced a whole week before Millie was born but the cheeky little girl decided she was ready to come even earlier. Two days before her planned induction, Sophie woke up in the early hours of the morning on March  with the urge to go to the toilet. She texted her friend to say she didnapost feel well and that she was going to go into the garden for some fresh air but her pal quickly warned her not to in case she gave birth.  But by the time her friendaposs advice came through on her phone, Sophie had already given birth to her newborn after pushing out her head instead of a aposnumber twoapos. She did one more big push outside the toilet door with her panicked partner Chris, who works as a storeman, in front of her - and baby Millie was born. Sophie said: I sat on the toilet, literally did a push and had the feeling that I should feel between my legs because it didnapost feel like a poo. I put my hand down and I just felt her head! It was four in the morning, it was just so unexpected. I was calling Chrisapos name as her head came out but so much energy was going into me giving birth, I felt like the lady off of Titanic, shouting aposhelpapos but it wasnapost coming out loud enough! I thought heaposs not going to wake up but then when I got off the toilet, he was stood there in the doorway so he must have heard me. I just looked at him and said aposyouaposve got to do the rest!apos His face dropped but then the phone came out, he was talking to the paramedics, it all happened so fast.  My two other kids both woke up in the commotion as well so I had my eight year old poking her head round her bedroom door asking aposMummy, are you ok apos Iaposm like aposyeah, Iaposm ok darling, just stay in your room for a minute!apos I went from sat on the toilet to outside my toilet door on the top of the stairs, did one push and she was out! I asked Chris afterwardshe was alright and he was like aposyeah, that was mad!apos Sophie remained on top of her stairs cradling her new born with the placenta still inside her for  minutes before a paramedic arrived. The umbilical cord was cut and Sophie and Millie were taken to hospital to be checked over but were released after a couple of hours in perfect health. Sophie said: I was shocked when I gave birth to my first so quickly but Iaposm just in disbelief that I ended up giving birth at home once again and even quicker! I had no pain relief with two of my kids and the after-pain with my third was terrible from where I was straining so much because I thought she was a poo. I was left so sore for weeks - I literally felt like a baboon!  I hear peopleaposs stories and I know several people who have been in labour for  hours and I canapost possibly imagine that! Iaposve never experienced that - my longest labour was  minutes and Iaposve had three children. I do feel sorry for these people who have to go through it!

title: one area uk could stay
story: NewsOne area of UK could stay in lockdown with spread of Covid uncontrolled, officials warnMoray, in north-eastern Scotland, has an infection rate of more than  cases per ,. Since last month, hospital admissions have also been rising and people have been urged to get testedmirrorShareCommentsByChiara Fiorillo:,  MAY NewsCoronavirus infections in Moray are on the rise " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeOne area in the UK is at risk of staying in lockdown due to an uncontrolled outbreak of Covid-. Moray, in north-eastern Scotland, has an infection rate of more than  cases per ,, with hospital admissions on the rise.Public health officials have urged the public to get tested eventhey do not have any coronavirus symptoms.They said thatthe spread is not controlled, the current restrictions may not be lted - despite lockdown measures being eased in other parts of Scotland. Chris Littlejohn, deputy director of public health at NHS Grampian, said the current restrictions are not preventing further spread of the disease. He explained: In Moray we are now seeing uncontrolled, sustained community transmission, current restrictions are not containing it, and the situation is rapidly deteriorating. We are seeing hospitalisations from this - including in the under s - and we will see deaths,the situation is not brought under control. The area is currently under level three restrictions - with the rule of six in place, travel around Scotland allowed, shops, stores, cafes and restaurants open.  But while the country is set to move to level two on May  - which will see more restrictions being eased on social contact and further businesses allowed to reopen - Moray could remain in level threethe number of Covid infections does not decrease. The rate of infection in Moray - more than  cases per , people - is currently four times the level in other parts of Scotland. Nearby Aberdeenshire and Highland have just  and  cases per , people respectively.  Test positivity in Moray is at .%, while across Scotland the figure has been slightly above or below one in recent weeks. Since last month, hospital admissions in the area have also been rising, with Mr Littlejohn warning the situation is rapidly deteriorating. Door-to-door testing for coronavirus is now being considered in Moray due to the outbreak, NHS Grampian has said.

title: queen never tells anyone what
story: NewsQueen never tells anyone what her favourite food actually is - for very clever reasonThe Queen has attended banquets around the world and tried a number of dferent cuisines, but when it comes to her favourite food, shes been keeping the exact dish under wraps for yearsmirrorShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsThe Queen has eaten food all over the world " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeHer Majesty, the Queen, has eaten at a lot of fine establishments over the years, attending swanky banquets and having her own personal chef at the palace. As such, the -year-old is bound to have tried all sorts of cuisines and exotic specialities. Many people often wonder whether her own tastes and preferences are taken into account when travelling and eating abroad, but when it comes to her favourite food, there are few people who actually know what it is. And thereaposs a rather good reason why itaposs kept so secret.A royal insider has explained how the Queen doesnapost ulge her favourite food before travelling, so that she isnapost served the same thing everywhere she goes. As reported by The Express, Gordon Rayner, former royal correspondent for Thewho has covered more than  royal tours, said heaposd discovered this fact from a royal staff member.He said: As one of her staff told me, ‘If she said she had a favourite meal she would never get served anything .’ While some food choices might be kept under wraps, there are a few items she is known to love - including chocolate biscuit cake.Former Buckingham Palace chef, Darren McGrady, has spoken about the cake.

title: sainsburys takes down picture cream
story: NewsSainsburys takes down picture of cream tea that caused outrage in CornwallDisgusted Sainsburys customers in Truro, Cornwall complained about a photo of showing an "incorrectly" arranged cream tea that had clotted cream under a dollop of jammirrorShareCommentsBySam BeamishOllie Buckley:,  MAY NewsThis photo of a cream tea at a Sainsburys in Truro, Cornwall sparked outrage " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our money-saving tips and top offers direct to your inbox with the Mirror Money newsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeSainsburyaposs took down a picture of an incorrectly arranged cream tea after furious shoppers in Cornwall threatened to boycott the store. A photo of the sweet treat on a wall inside the store sparked a backlash from regulars in Truro. The image depicted a scone with cream spread on the bottom and a dollop of jam on the top. People in Cornwall have always put jam on first while folk in neighbouring Devon start with the clotted cream. Disgusted customers contacted Sainsburyaposs to complain, and as a result the supermarket chain apologised and quietly removed the photo from the baked goods aisle, CornwallLive reports. Who does a cream tea the proper way - Cornwall or Devon  Join the conversation in the comments section below. An empty frame now hangs on the wall where the picture was displayed. Sainsburyaposs said it had nothing more to say about the saga, which went viral. Earlier, Sainsburyaposs had said: Our afternoon tea has all scone wrong in Truro! We are reviewing the customer feedback we have received. Andreas Drosiadis, who took the original photo and runs the Mediterraneo deli in Truro, posted the image on Facebook asking: How did this happen   Andreas, , said: England is a country with strong local traditions that shape our everyday le. Jam first is a characteristic example of this and Sainsburyaposs should have known better. CornwallLive, a Mirror sister website, joined the furore, tweeting: Sainsburyaposs whataposs this  A fruit scone! with the cream on first! advertised in a Cornish store.The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The cheek of it! Do you think this is acceptable  Sainsburyaposs replied: An imposter! Which store did you see this please  Weaposll have a word with them about this blasphemy! After learning of the store location, Sainsburyaposs added: Thataposll never do at all Truro! Iaposve logged some feedback to the manager of the store to ensure they are made aware of this imposter and repair it accordingly.  Andreasapos tweet went viral and renewed the debate over how to dress a scone - is it jam first or clotted cream  Originally from Greece, the deli owner said: Because the clotted cream is denser than the jam, the jam should go first and the clotted cream after so everything stays neat and clean without the jam pouring on your fingers. He added: We now have the British authority on etiquette to back up the argument. Thataposs how the Queen has it. On Twitter user wrote: Sainsburyaposs are correct. When you have jam on toast do you put the butter on after the jam...

the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA hilarious video shows the moment a young girl started shouting at an Amazon Alexa when the bot failed to understand her Scottish accent. Millie Kilpatrick can be heard politely saying aposAlexaapos twice but the virtual assistant remains unresponsive as the childaposs temper starts to boil.The five-year-old from Stenhousemuir, near Falkirk, Scotland, then begins to lose her patience with the bot and shouts Alexa, Alexa, Iaposm trying to talk to you hen, as reported in the Daily Star.When Alexa still doesnapost understand, Millie can then be heard saying: Are you telling me  Donapost you dare tell me... Her mum, Caitlyn captured the incident on camera back in June , as her daughter was telling the gadget off and shared the clip on social media. The youngster was on top of the world after going viral with the video racking up more than , views in just two days. Speaking at the time, Kaitlyn told the Daily Record: We can’t believe it to be honest, my phone has been going off the hook. “I always upload videos like this but this has never happened, it’s crazy. “Millie is loving it and thinks she’s famous, which was funny until I told her it was her bedtime and she replied ‘you can’t speak to a famous person like that’.  “We’ve been contacted by loads of people from places like Poland and Italy who said they loved her accent. “It was quite surreal because I had to use google translate to work out what they were saying.” Mum-of-two Caitlyn revealed Millie’s outburst is not typical and she’s usually “very quiet”. But even she was pushed over the edge by Alexa’s failure to understand her simple commands. Caitlyn said “She’s confident and up for anything but she’s really quiet. But then on the odd occasion she has a wee spell.

use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticePunters hoping for a weekend of pints Britainaposs pub beer gardens and picnics in the park face another round of spring weather disappointment. Hopes a chilly April would give way to a warmer May are yet to be realised, as forecasters predict another washout is in store. But lucky punters in some areas should get a break from the wintry conditions by Sunday. A aposmini-heatwaveapos with highs of C is forecast to bless London and some areas of South East England by the end of the weekend while almost everywhere  gets lashed by wind and rain, the Met Office says. The grim prediction comes after the UK shivered through the coldest early May bank holiday weekend on record. Frosty temperatures hit many parts of the country, with -.C recorded at Kinbrace in the Highlands in Scotland - matching the  May bank holiday record. And this weekend is not looking much sunnier for most parts of the country as the spring chill lingers at a time when coronavirus lockdown restrictions continue to restrict socialising to outdoor mixing. While the wintry snap is set to be replaced by a warmer weekend, it will be wetter and windier, forecasters have warned. A band of snowy showers - along with a chance of hail and thunder - are likely to continue into Friday.  Spokeswoman Nicola Maxey said snowfall was not that unusual in England in May, with some as recently as last year, but lying snow was much more uncommon for the time of year. The last time snow accumulated in any quantity at this time in May was in , when several centimetres settled in Scotland, Wales and northern England. Ms Maxey said: Through spring you get these swings in weather types. So itaposs not unusual to see a cold snap through April and May. During those cold snaps you potentially see a bit of falling snow but generally over higher ground and generally in the north.  She said snow settling was much more rare as the ground is warming up, evenit does not feel like it. Temperatures are rising during the day and, eventheyaposre not rising to what we expect in April and May, they are warm enough to melt snow. Ms Maxey said the sun is also quite strong at this time of year, meaning some people are suffering sunburn on clear days even though it feels quite close. She said more snow and hail showers could be expected on Friday, but temperatures will rise at the weekend when a cold air mass is nudged out of the way by a warmer system from the Atlantic.  But Ms Maxey said the weather will be giving with one hand and taking with the other as this system will bring wind and rain on Saturday. She said: At the weekend weaposve got one of these low pressure systems coming in which pushes the high pressure out of the way and allows the temperatures to rise a bit but brings some wet and windy weather. It pushes in from the South West on Saturday morning and by Saturday evening it will have reached as far as the north of Scotland. You will see temperatures pushing up a bit then and ing more to normal with the South East potentially seeing temperatures as high as C just for Saturday. But weaposll see some rain and breezy conditions and some of that rain could be quite heavy. Ms Maxey said places like Dartmoor could see as much as mm of rain in the  hours to Saturday.

title: uk weather mini 20c weekend
story: NewsUK weather: Mini C weekend heatwave after miserable downpours and icy coldOn the back of torrential weather and icy cold London will bask in temperatures of C, say forecasters, with many looking forward to sunnier climates this weekendmirrorShareCommentsByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  MAY NewsThe south will see balmy weatheron Sunday " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeWhile rain and icy weather is set to batter the country again today there is light at the end of the tunnel as forecasters predict a mini-heatwave on Sunday.On the back of torrential weather and icy cold London and parts of the south will bask in temperatures of  C as many look ahead to sunnier climates this weekend.But before the warmer weather Thursday promises to be yet another cold and wet washout with many waking up to sub-zero temperatures once again.Speaking of Thursdayaposs weather Met Office forecaster Clare Nasir said it will be a aposwintry start to the dayapos this morning with sleet and snow in Scotland.Elsewhere she said there would be pockets of rain with sunny spells in many UK regions. She said: A mostly dry start for much of England where we will see some sunshine but it will be chilly. The temperatures will yet again struggle, itaposs going to be a chilly day. It comes after widespread rain, hailstones and even lightning were seen across the country on Wednesday. Looking ahead to the coming days Alex Burkill, a Met Office forecaster, said: For the rest of the week, rainfall will be rather hefty in some places, with as much as -mm falling in just an hour in the worst-affected spots.  A signicant amount of hail could potentially cause some disruption to roads and public transport. He said heavy downpours will then lash the country on Saturday. He added: Most areas will be affected by heavy and persistent rain and strong winds over the weekend. Sunday should be drier for most, with some showers in places, but in the south-east of England, temperatures could climb into the low twenties by the afternoon.  People should make the most of any dry or sunny spots, as it is unlikely to last and the rest of May will be unsettled and changeable for everyone. On Sunday the capital is forecast to reach peak sunshine conditions with highs in the mid-s, the Met Office says.

news us-news archies-very-un-royal-le-"" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice Archie Mountbatten-Windsor was just a few months old when his parents Prince Harry and Meghan Markle made a decision that would change his le forever.They shocked their families and well-wishers around the world when they announced their plans to quit their royal jobs and move to America. A year later, the couple are carving out a new le including million-dollar business deals, celebrity pals and a Calornian mansion. In their quitting statement, Meghan and Harry said they planned to raise Archie with an appreciation for the royal tradition into which he was born but with space to focus on the next chapter. To mark his second birthday, weaposve taken a look at what Archieaposs post-royal le is like and how it dfers to his cousins Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. Family While Archie is growing up on the other side of the Atlantic to his royal family, heaposs just up the road from his other grandmother - Meghanaposs mum Doria. The Duchess is extremely close to her mum and she was in the room supporting her daughter through Archieaposs birth. Itaposs likely that Doria has played a big role in Archieaposs le so far and spends lots of time with him.  However the distance means heaposs not been able to enjoy the company of Charles and Camilla, nor his Uncle William or Auntie Kate. While Harry was reunited with his family at his grandfather Prince Philipaposs funeral last month, Archie and heavily pregnant Meghan stayed at home. However Archie has been able to see his cousins, aunt and uncle, and grandparents via video call during the pandemic.The Sussexes also spoke regularly to the Queen and Prince Philip before his death last month.Photos and the public eyeWhile Kate and William release photos of their children, Meghan and Harry have unsurprisingly shared far fewer images of their son since quitting royal le.The couple decided against the tradition of posing for photos on the hospital steps following the birth and instead arranged a photocall for a small group of the media a few days later. The couple also kept the christening as a private celebration but released two official photos from the day.Before shutting down their Sussex Royal Instagram page they shared a handful of snaps, including a picture of his foot in front of Princess Dianaaposs favourite flowers to mark Motheraposs Day and one of Archie and Charles on the Prince of Walesaposs birthday.Since stepping down Meghan and Harry have used the publication of new photos to promote charities they are passionate about.For his first birthday, they shared an adorable video of Meghan reading her son his favourite book, Rabbit! Duck!. Love the royals for our daily royal newsletter by clicking here.It was shared as part of Save the Childrenaposs Save with Stories campaign, which aims to raise funds for children and families struggling due to the coronavirus crisis in the UK and around the world.They stuck with the royal familyaposs tradition of sharing a Christmas photo, however used a digitally sketched picture rather than a photo. The arty card, which shows the couple, Archie and their two dogs playing in a Wendy house, was released in partnership with animal welfare charity Mayhew, which Meghan is patron of.  Archie also appears in one of the two photos released by the couple when they announced they are expecting their second child, a baby girl.Archie also made a guest appearance on his parentsapos debut podcast for Archewell Audio.After speaking to the likes of Sir Elton John and James Cordon on the holiday special, the proud parents brought little Archie to the microphone, with Harry saying: You can speak into it. Meghan then asks: Archie is it fun  and he repeats the word fun. The tot then copies his dad to say Happy New Year, followed by an adorable giggle. The couple shared a rare video of Archie playing on the beach as part of their controversial interview with Oprah Winfrey.  Home leIf the Sussexes had stayed in the UK, Archie would have grown up in the stunning Frogmore Cottage.The house, in the grounds of Windsor Castle, was a wedding gt to Meghan and Harry from the Queen.  Before this, there had been plans for the couple to move into one of the bigger apartments in Kensington Palace, just a few doors up from the Cambridges. This would have allowed Archie to spend a lot of time with his cousins and other family members. But instead, little Archie spent a few months in Canada before Meghan and Harry moved into movie producer Tyler Perryaposs LA house.Last summer they bought their first proper family home, a stunning £.million pad in Montecito, Santa Barbara.

title: inside archies birthday celebrations meghan
story: NewsInside Archies birthday celebrations with Meghan, Harry and royal Zoom callsArchie has turned two years old and will be celebrating his second birthday at the multi-million pound luxury mansion he shares with parents Meghan Markle and Prince Harry in CalorniamirrorShareCommentsByTalia ShadwellReporter:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsFans will be hoping to see fresh pictures of rarely young Archie as he marks his second birthday " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice Birthday boy Archie is set to get some face time with the Queen, Prince William and Kate Middleton on his special day, an insider claims. Senior royals are expected to put aside their rt with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle for at least a few hours mark their sonaposs special milestone.The couple are living with Archie in a multimillion-pound luxury mansion in Montecito, Calornia, where he will turn two today more than , miles away from his royal relatives in Britain. The Sussexes are expected to celebrate the toddleraposs birthday with a Zoom call to his grandmother, the Queen, and a call with his aunt and uncle, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. While fans eagerly wait to see whether they Sussexes will release any special new photos of rarely seen Archie on his big day, his loved ones have already wished the youngster a happy birthday publicly.The Queen, in a message on the official royal family Twitter account, accompanied by a photograph of her great-grandson with his parents days after he was born, said: Wishing Archie Mountbatten-Windsor a very happy nd birthday today.Also sending him warm tidings from afar, Harryaposs brother, Kate and William wished Archie a very happy birthday, alongside another christening photo showing the family together. Charles and his we, Camilla the Duchess of Cornwall, shared a photo of Harry proudly showing Archie off to the childaposs grandfather at his christening.  Speaking to OK, royal author Katie Nicholl said: “Harry... always wanted his children to grow up close to William and Kate’s. That would be the childhood he enjoyed with his own cousins, Zara, Beatrice and Eugenie. Sadly it’s looking increasingly unlikely for Archie.“Very little is known about how much the brothers have spoken in recent months and what the situation is between them, but I find it hard to imagine that the Cambridges won’t at least pick up the phone on Archie’s birthday.” Ms Nicholl also speculated a video call with Her Majesty will take place on her grandsonaposs birthday.  She said: “We know that Harry still speaks regularly with his grandmother and one of the Queen’s joys is to see Archie. I’m sure there will be a Zoom call with her on his special day,” she says. Fans will be hoping the couple follow royal tradition and release a picture of Archie to mark his second birthday.Archie has only been seen rarely during the past  months, during the coronavirus pandemic which saw him celebrate his first birthday in lockdown with his parents in Calornia during its aposstay at homeapos orders last May.He was shown in a black and white video clip released in March during his parentsapos bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey.  The never-seen-before black and white footage showed him walking along a beach watched by his parents and the familyaposs pet dog, Guy. As he walked towards his father, who filmed the moment, the youngster ducked down and walked through the gap in his legs.The couple also offered fresh insights into his le Stateside during the explosive interview.Harry revealed details including that Archie likes being taken on bike rides in his baby seat, where he sticks his arms out and shouts woooo and points out passing sights. Meghan said Archie,has been on a roll in learning to talk, and his current favourite word is hydrate. Harry recently told James Corden that Archieaposs first word was crocodile. When Archie made a surprise appearance in the Sussexesapos first podcast for Spoty in December, the little boyaposs American accent could clearly be heard as he was encouraged to say a few words for the audience.  He was also glimpsed with his face turned away from the camera in one of Meghan and Harryaposs pregnancy announcement pictures the couple shared earlier this year. In the picture announcing they were having a baby girl, Meghan stands under a tree holding Archie as Harry embraces her. Meghan this week revealed her son and husband and their special bond was the inspiration behind her first childrenaposs book, The Bench. She says the book was based on a poem she wrote for Harry on Fatheraposs Day after their son was born.Archie was born on May   at .am, weighing lb oz, and a few days after his birth his parents proudly showed him to the world, before the Queen and Prince Philip saw him for the first time.The late Duke of Edinburgh sadly missed out on marking his grandsonaposs second birthday. He died last month aged , and Harry ed for his funeral at Windsor Castle. Todayaposs speculated birthday calls with William and Kate will likely be a rare interaction for the Sussexes and Cambridges.

title: woman who started menopause 30s
story: NewsWoman who started menopause in her s has become a mum of identical tripletsHollie Gambrel, then , from Texas, US, was informed after eight months of inconsistent periods that she was transitioning into menopause but got pregnant through IVFmirrorShareCommentsByLucy Notarantonio:,  MAY NewsHollie says she and husband David are so thankful " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA woman who was she told she was premenopausal managed to get pregnant - with identical triplets. Hollie Gambrel, then , was informed after eight months of inconsistent periods that she was transitioning into menopause. But she and husband David were still determined to get pregnant - evenit meant using an anonymous egg donor. Friends and family rallied round to help the couple from Texas, US, raise the ,for the IVF treatment. And they were delighted to find out that the fertilised egg had split into three - odds of one in  million. Got a story  Email webnews@mirror. Kids Rory, Ryder, Rhett are now aged one and Hollie, who was a teacher, couldn’t be happier. The stay-at-home mum said: I’m speechless sometimes because I can’t believe I have three babies. I want others to know there is a way - it may not be the way you planned but it will always work out. I was heartbroken about not having my own but happy that my husband was able to have his own biological baby. The couple began saving every penny they earned to fund the costly IVF treatment. Their generous friends and family donated over , .  Hollie then selected a donor in May  who had similar characteristics to herself, such as blonde hair and being a keen runner. I felt so grateful picking a donor, she said. It was amazing to know there was someone who would give their eggs so I can try and have my own family. We were able to see the profiles and photos of dferent women who were approved by the doctoraposs office. I chose a woman who looked like me with blonde hair but she had blue eyes and I have brown. She was a similar height, athletic and a runner - like me. There were  eggs available but just one embryo was transferred in August .  She adds: On August , a blood test revealed I was pregnant. We were ecstatic as we had been waiting for this result for two years. But nothing could have prepared us for the news we received at the four-week scan. We turned bright red when they said ‘three babies’. I was in disbelief and I couldn’t stop laughing. I thought it was a joke. David was speechless. It took us a while to get our heads around but I was over the moon. Hollie was fortunate enough to work until  weeks before having a planned C-section one week later. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  She adds: “Pregnancy was the best thing ever. I had no issues apart from a huge stomach. “I gained st lbs [lbs] but it was fine. “The babies were taken into NICU but they were thriving.” Hollie describes le with triplets as ‘crazy’. The couple upsized their two-door jeep to a minivan ahead of their arrival. She said: There’s a lot of running up and down the stairs, bottles, nappies, kisses and cuddles. Rory and Rhett play with each other the most whereas Ryder is focussed on playing with a toy alone. We are so thankful for everyone who helped us on this journey.

title: aldi divides customers brings back
story: NewsAldi ides customers as it brings back mince pies for Junemas celebrationGerman supermarket giant Aldi has ided people on Facebook as it encouraged everyone to celebrate Christmas in June as coronavirus restrictions ease - but not everyone is thrilled with the newsmirrorShareCommentsByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  MAY NewsAldi have ided opinions online " %, rgba, rgba, url" to FREE email alerts from Mirror - Bright Stuff NewsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.SubscribeWhen you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeAfter strict coronavirus restrictions put a stop to much of the UKaposs Christmas plans, people joked that they would push festivities back until after the Easter holiday when lockdown measures ease. However, Aldi has taken the idea seriously, as it revealed its plans to celebrate the holiday on June , now known as aposJunemasapos. But the idea has been met with mixed opinions as many shoppers joked the German retailer is trying to sht out-of-date stock.In a statement on Facebook, Aldi wrote: Letaposs be honest, last Christmas didnapost have our hearts, and sleigh bells werenapost ringing like they usually do.So we think itaposs time for round two. A proper Christmas where you can hug your nan, get the whole family together and go to town with all the trimmings. Just one thing. Itaposs in June. INTRODUCING JUNEMAS. Mark your calendars for June th, look out for some surprises in-store and be NICE. #AldiJunemas. The first fan favourite toto the store is its mince pies which you can pick up from June . In the comments, one person said: I was in hospital over Christmas with covid so Christmas wasn’t an option in our house. This is a great idea. Another comment read: Too late!! We’re having Christmas Day at the end of May! These would’ve been perfect! Whilst a third person said: I hope that there will be a Christmas Cuthbert too. Does that mean I can put my tree up  asked another excited shopper. But a few customers joked that the supermarket had come up with the initiative to sht old stock.

title: barber left mortified after asking
story: NewsBarber left mortied after asking awkward question to blind customer about haircutA barber went into autopilot after finishing a haircut and asked one of his clients a stock question before realising the mistake - and theyve now shared the awkward blunder onlinemirrorShareCommentsByJohn Bett:,  MAY NewsOthers reassured them it happens all the time " %, rgba, rgba, url" to FREE email alerts from Mirror - Bright Stuff NewsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.SubscribeWhen you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA hairdresser says they were left feeling mortied by an interaction with a client - but other people told them not to beat themselves up over the common error. The unnamed barber says they were giving a cut to a blind man, who was very specic about what he wanted, adding that he clearly had issues with his sight and walked with a cane. Feeling horried by their interaction at the end of the cut, the hairdresser turned to Reddit for support, writing: I’m a barber and our customer base is mainly older men, a couple weeks ago a blind man came in to get his hair cut. He had a stick and his eyes were very foggy, I’m not very informed about the specic types of blindness, but he definitely couldn’t see himself in the mirror. He was quite specic about how he wanted it done, so I asked him to feel it every so often to make sure he was happy with it so far. It was all going well and we were making good conversation. But typical me - I got to the end of his haircut and blew all the excess hair off before asking him, aposalright, all done, does it all look short enough for you apos Then I realised what I had done. I didn’t know what to say, I was horried at what had just happened. He sat there awkwardly for a few seconds before feeling around and stating that his haircut was fine. I’m still mortied, but I’m feeling more comfort in sharing my experience. Won’t be making that mistake again, bless him.

title: mum faces backlash letting kids
story: NewsMum faces backlash for letting kids swim in pool where neighbours child drownedA family moved into a house after learning about the death of child in the swimming pool, deciding they could look past the tragic accident that had taken placemirrorShareCommentsByJohn Bett:,  MAY NewsA mother was criticised after letting her kids swim in a pool where a neighbours child had drowned" %, rgba, rgba, url" to FREE email alerts from Mirror - Bright Stuff NewsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.SubscribeWhen you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA mum has faced backlash in the local community after letting her kids swim in a pool where a neighbouraposs child had drowned. The woman and her family had been looking for a house when they found the ideal home, complete with swimming pool, within their budget. They then discovered the reason for the discount price - a neighbouraposs child had drowned in the pool during a party, leaving the local community devastated. But the mother decided she could look past the terrible incident and the family moved in, and soon after they refilled the pool.Then, when the weather was fitting, she let her kids play in the pool - and soon received a slew of complaints from her neighbours.The mum said: So when my husband and I were looking at houses we found this great one with a pool in the backyard. Normally it would have been out of our price range, but this one was a great deal. The reason why was because one of the neighbouraposs children had drowned in the pool last summer. I know it’s really morbid, but my husband and I discussed it and we decided we could look past it. I mean we could never otherwise afford anything like it. It was big enough that all our kids could finally have their own bedrooms. When we had moved in the pool was empty and we didn’t see the point in filling it since at the time it was too cold out to go swimming anyway.  Since it’s getting hot out now we decided to finally fill it last week. Our kids had a great time swimming and were having fun laughing and playing games. Later though husband was confronted by our neighbour, the one whose kid died, saying that the sounds of kids playing in the pool was traumatising to his family and that we were horrible for letting our kids play in that pool after what happened. Since then we’ve learned from an online post that several other people in the neighbourhood similarly feel that we are being insensitive by letting out kids play in the pool. Many of them thinking that the right thing to do would have been to get rid of the pool or fill it up. Even considering it all though we don’t want to get rid of our pool. We never had a pool before, but now we’re really enjoying it and our kids do too.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeAfter having kids, le is never quite the same again - and even when they get older and leave home, they are still going to need you to be there for them. Being a parent is a full-time job, so the idea of having a few days off from that could certainly be appealing. One mum has gone to extreme s to ensure she isnapost bothered by her child while away on holiday with her husband.The dad has gone viral on social media after sharing a look at the hilarious emergency contact list his we made for their daughter, who is currently home from college.The list features a number of dferent scenarios the young woman could face while theyaposre on vacation - and who she should call in each circumstance. Essentially, the rule is call anybody except for her parents.  The parent, who posts on TikTok under the name @korish, said: Came home from work to see my we made our kid who is home from college a list of who to call when we are on vacation.Who ya gonna call  NOT US. Examples on the call list include: If you think you f***ed up, but you arenapost surewe will care... call Theresa. If you know you f***ed up and you need help covering it up... call Caroline. If you f***ed up and youaposre in jail... call Holden.  The list also features the order in which they should call peoplethe first person doesnapost answer. Each list ends with a bright red reminder not to call mum or dad.Other examples include emergency contacts to go toshe misses the dogs Instagram ,she feels lonelyand who to callshe needs money to fix it .The video has gone viral, being viewed more than two million times and garnering over , likes.

title: woman think shes been burgled
story: NewsWoman thinks shes been burgled after her dog destroys sofa and breaks down doorVickie Shelton, , was left distraught after ing home and finding her sofa destroyed, before discovering it was her beloved two-year-old dog Bo who had caused the damagemirrorShareCommentsByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsCheeky Bo with his owner Vickie " %, rgba, rgba, url"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA woman had the shock of her le after ing home to find her sofa ripped to pieces. Mum Vickie Shelton, , thought sheaposd been robbed but soon discovered the culprit was her two-year-old dog Bo. The naughty pooch had destroyed her sofa while Vickie was at work, leaving fluff all over the room. Vickie, , from Benton, Tennessee, USA, decided to keep Bo in the spare room while at work the next day, in order to avoid more damage. But determined Bo chewed his way out of the wire crate and broke down the door. Vickie, who works in HR, said: “We’d only had the couch for four months when it all happened.  “Bo sleeps on the couch a lot, that is definitely his domain. He loves it.“I was at work, and I was getting alerts from my pet camera that something was happening, but I thought it was just Bo being Bo.“Never in a million years did I think he was destroying my couch.“I got home that afternoon and the dogs were greeting me at the door. I took a few steps inside and started seeing this white fluff everywhere.“Once I got to the living room, that’s when I saw the couch. My first thought was that I had been robbed and vandalised.“But then I saw the TV on the wall, and I thought, well why would they tear the couch up and leave the TV “Bo then sits down in the middle of the mess, wagging his tail. He was very happy with himself.“That’s when it all clicked. I couldn’t believe it.“It took over two hours to clean it all up, and there were six huge plastic bags full of fluff.”The next morning, Vickie kept Bo in her son’s room in a crate while she was at work to help keep him out of the way.But when she ed, he had chewed through the wire and broken down the door.She said: “I put the crate in my son’s bedroom and closed the door.“I turned on the TV with calming sounds, put on the fans, put his toys in with him. I thought he’s going to have a good day.“When I came home from work, there he was at the door. I thought ‘oh no, this cannot be good’.“There was a massive hole in my son’s door, and he had chewed his way through the crate.“I panicked because I thought he had cut his mouth to pieces, so I took him to the vet. But he was totally fine.”After visiting the vet, Bo was diagnosed with severe separation anxiety and has been put on a low dose of ‘puppy xanax’ to help keep him calm.Thankfully the pooch is doing a lot better and went viral after Vickie shared photos of the damage on social media.Vickie said: “The medicine seems to be working, I think it’s just what he needed. It is helping him stay calm and happy during the times when I’m not around.

title: real life sleeping beauty 17
story: NewsReal-le Sleeping Beauty, , spends weeks on end asleep without waking upTeenager Siti Raisa Miranda can sleep for weeks at a time thanks to her condition that affects one in a million people.mirrorShareCommentsByKelly-Ann MillsReporter:,  MAY NewsHer parents take her to hospital when she has an episode " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA aposreal-le Sleeping Beautyapos has an extremely rare medical condition where she can sleep for weeks without being woken up. Siti Raisa Miranda had her first symptoms back in  when she slept for  days straight at her home in Banjarmasin, Indonesia. Her worried parents rushed her to the hospital where medics diagnosed her with Kleine-Levin Syndromethat affects one in a million people. After learning of her condition her parents would take Siti to the hospital where she would sleep for at least a week. Her father Mulyadi said this week that his daughter, now , would not wake up no matter what they did so they always take her to the medics whenever she had episodes. He said: We donapost know how to make sure sheaposs fine whenever she falls asleep so we take her to the doctor. Whenever she sleeps longer than a week she will suffer from convulsions, so we really need the hospitalaposs help during those times. Mulyadi added that her daughter was healthy despite her condition.
